Goals.AddNewGoalOrEditExistingGoal: %1$sAdd a new goal%2$s or %3$sEdit%4$s existing goals
Goals.AllowGoalConvertedMoreThanOncePerVisit: Allow goal to be converted more than once per visit
Goals.BestCountries: The countries with the most conversions are:
Goals.BestKeywords: The keywords with the most conversions are:
Goals.BestReferrers: These are the referring websites with the most conversions:
Goals.BestEntryPage: The entry page with the most conversions is:
Goals.CancelAndReturnToGoals: Cancel and %1$sreturn to the list of goals%2$s
Goals.ClickOutlink: Click on a link to an external website
Goals.ColumnAverageOrderRevenueDocumentation: Average order value (AOV) is the total revenue from all e-commerce orders divided by the number of orders.
Goals.ColumnAverageQuantityDocumentation: The average quantity of this %s sold in e-commerce orders.
Goals.ColumnConversionRateDocumentation: The percentage of visits that triggered the %s goal.
Goals.ColumnConversionRatePageViewedBeforeDocu: The percentage of all conversions for the %s goal where this page was viewed before conversion.
Goals.ColumnConversionRateProductDocumentation: The %s conversion rate is the number of orders containing this product divided by number of visits on the product page.
Goals.ColumnOrdersDocumentation: The total number of e-commerce orders which contained this %s at least once.
Goals.ColumnPurchasedProductsDocumentation: The number of purchased products is the sum product quantity of all e-commerce orders sold.
Goals.ColumnQuantityDocumentation: Quantity is the total number of products sold for each %s.
Goals.ColumnRevenuePerVisitDocumentation: The total revenue generated by %s divided by the number of visits.
Goals.ColumnRevenuePerEntryDocumentation: The total revenue generated by %s divided by the number of visitor entries.
Goals.ColumnVisits: The total number of visits, regardless of whether a goal was triggered or not.
Goals.ColumnVisitsProductDocumentation: The number of visits on the Product/Category page. Also used to process the %s conversion rate. This metric is in the report if e-commerce view-tracking was set up on the Product/Category pages.
Goals.ConversionByTypeReportDocumentation: This report provides detailed info about the goal performance (conversions, conversion rates and revenue per visit) for each of the categories available in the left panel. %1$s Please click on one of the categories to view the report. %2$s For more info, read the %3$sTracking goals documentation%4$s
Goals.ConversionsOverviewBy: Conversion overview by type of visit
Goals.DaysToConvReportDocumentation: This report shows the amount of days between arrival and goal conversions made by visitors.
Goals.DefaultGoalConvertedOncePerVisit: (default) Goal can only be converted once per visit
Goals.DefaultRevenueHelp: For example, a contact form submitted by a visitor may be worth $10 on average. Matomo will help you understand how well your visitor segments are performing.
Goals.DocumentationRevenueGeneratedByProductSa: Product sales. Excludes tax, shipping and discount
Goals.EntryPagesReportDocumentation: This report shows how each entry page contributed to goal conversions.
Goals.ExceptionInvalidMatchingString: If you choose 'exact match', the matching string must be a URL starting with %1$s. For example, '%2$s'.
Goals.GoalsOverviewDocumentation: An overview of your goal conversions. Initially, the graph shows the sum of all conversions. %s Below the graph, you can see conversion reports for each of your goals. The sparklines can be enlarged by clicking on them.
Goals.HelpOneConversionPerVisit: If a Page matching this goal is refreshed or viewed more than once during a visit, the goal will only be tracked the first time the page was loaded during the visit.
Goals.LearnMoreAboutGoalTrackingDocumentation: Learn more about %1$stracking goals%2$s in Matomo in the user documentation.
Goals.ManuallyTriggeredUsingJavascriptFunction: A goal is manually triggered using the JavaScript API trackGoal()
Goals.NewGoalIntro: Tracking of goal conversions is one of the most efficient ways to measure and improve your business objectives.
Goals.NewVisitorsConversionRateIs: The conversion rate for new visitors is %s
Goals.NoGoalsNeedAccess2:
Only a user with write access, an administrator or a user with super user access can manage goals for a given website. Please ask your Matomo administrator to set up a goal for your website.
Tracking goals is a great way to help understand and maximize your website performance!
Goals.NoConversionsNoReportsMessage: Reports are not displayed because there is no conversion data for the selected goal and period.
Goals.NeedAccess: Only an administrator or a user with super user access can manage goals for a given website.
Goals.OverallConversionRate: overall conversion rate (visits with a completed goal)
Goals.PagesReportDocumentation: This report shows how each page URL contributed to goal conversions.
Goals.PagesTitlesReportDocumentation: This report shows how each page title contributed to goal conversions.
Goals.PluginDescription: Create goals and see detailed reports about your goal conversions: evolution over time, revenue per visit, conversions per referrer, per keyword, and more.
Goals.ReturningVisitorsConversionRateIs: The conversion rate for returning visitors is %s
Goals.SingleGoalOverviewDocumentation: This is an overview of the conversions for a single goal. %s The sparklines below the graph can be enlarged by clicking on them.
Goals.ThereIsNoGoalToManage: There is no goal to manage for the %s website
Goals.VisitsUntilConvReportDocumentation: This report shows the number of visits made before a visitor converts a goal.
Goals.VisitUrl: Visit a given URL (page or group of pages)
Goals.VisitDurationMatchAttr: Stay for a certain amount of time
Goals.WhereVisitedPageManuallyCallsJavascriptT: The visited page needs to contain a call to the JavaScript 'trackGoal' method (%1$slearn more%2$s)
Goals.YouCanEnableEcommerceReports: You can turn on %1$s for this website on the %2$s page.
Goals.UseEventValueAsRevenue: Use the event value (if it exists) as the goal conversion revenue.
Goals.EventValueAsRevenueHelp: If the event you are matching has a revenue, and that revenue is tracked as the event value, you can turn this on to record the event value as the goal conversion's revenue. If your goal revenue does not vary per conversion, you can ignore this option and just set a default revenue above.
Goals.EventValueAsRevenueHelp2: Note: If both a default goal revenue and event value are defined, the event value will be used. If this is turned on and no event value is sent in a request, the default revenue will be used (if defined).
Goals.AtLeastMinutes: at least %1$s minutes. Use decimals to match seconds, for example, %2$s to match 30 seconds.
Goals.OverviewReportDocumentation: This report gives an overview of how well your visitors convert a specific goal.
Goals.GoalsOverviewSubcategoryHelp1: The overview of goals reports on the performance of those defined for your website. You can access your goalâ€™s conversion percentages, amount of revenue generated and full reports for each.
Goals.GoalsOverviewSubcategoryHelp2: Click on an individual metric within the sparkline chart to focus on it within the full-sized evolution graph.
Goals.ManageGoalsSubcategoryHelp1: This section allows creating and editing goals for specific actions which visitors undertake on your site, such as visiting a certain page or submitting a specific form. Goal reports vary but can help you track your website performance against business objectives such as lead generation, online sales and increased brand exposure.
Goals.ManageGoalsSubcategoryHelp2: Learn more in the goals guide here.
Goals.ColumnRevenueAttributedDocumentation: The share of all revenue for %s where this page was viewed before conversion.
Goals.ColumnConversionsEntryDocumentation: The total number of goal conversions where this page was the entry page.
Goals.ColumnConversionEntryRateDocumentation: The percent of entrances that were converted for %s.
Goals.ColumnRevenueEntryDocumentation: The share of all revenue for %s where this page was the entry page.
